abstract.text: Indoor location that actually works!

inlineContent.text: SpaceKit provides advanced indoor positioning, maps, navigation and augmented reality directions in an easy-to-implement framework for iOS applications to take advantage of.
It comprises of 4 key layers in a stack that make up our framework. Each layer builds upon the other, with HyperLocation being the foundation upon which all the other layers are built apon.

Other location technology don’t work well indoors. GPS requires a  line-of-sight from a number of overhead satellites to triangulate a position. In a typical indoor scenario, concrete, metal structures and power cables prevent GPS signals reaching a user’s mobile device while Bluetooth iBeacons aren’t very accurate and require regular monitoring to ensure their batteries haven’t failed or that they haven’t been moved.

Instead, with HyperLocation, we’ve built it with location in mind from the start. We use a wide variety of device sensors, camera data and previously-surveyed Wi-Fi data fed into our finely-tuned ML models and algorithms to provide
location information indoors to sub-1m accuracy.
Another key part of our technology are our detailed indoor maps. These rich maps are the backbone to the

. Typically created in our online Hyper Map Creator “portal”, these maps contain a complete digital twin of a retail environment from walls, sections, floors all the way down to individual fixtures and till points which we render as a 3D map and use to help calculate navigation routes.

In addition to our rich highly-detailed maps and advanced location technology, is our navigation technology. We use these components to create dynamic route plans that help customers find your products quicker and faster than they could on their own.

Once a customer has a route set, they can switch to Augmented Reality directions. This combines HyperLocation, a lively dynamic arrow and text directions which are then overlayed over a camera interface to provide an easy map-free way of finding an item.
